title: Yiquan Gu
text:
Professor of Spatial Economics and Industrial Organization at Henley Business School, University of Reading
British Academy and Bridging Responsible AI Divides Innovation Fellow at the Digital Regulation Cooperation Forum
Associate Editor, Economic Modelling
Main research interests: Industrial Organization, Digital Economy, Game Theory and Spatial Economics

title: Yiquan Gu
text:
Industrial Organization

Consumer Salience and Quality Provision in (Un)Regulated Public Service Markets (with Alexander Rasch and Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, Regional Science and Urban Economics, March 2022
Data brokers co-opetition (with Leo Madio and Carlo Reggiani), Online Supplementary Material, Oxford Economic Papers, July 2022
Curbing Obfuscation: Empower Consumers or Regulate Firms? (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, Online Supplementary Material, International Journal of Industrial Organization, May 2020
Consumer confusion, obfuscation, and price regulation (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, Scottish Journal of Political Economy, May 2017
Price-Sensitive Demand and Market Entry (with Alexander Rasch and Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, Papers in Regional Science, November 2016
Putting on a Tight Leash and Levelling Playing Field: An Experiment in Strategic Obfuscation and Consumer Protection (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, International Journal of Industrial Organization, September 2015
Strategic obfuscation and consumer protection policy (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, Journal of Industrial Economics, December 2014
Too much of a good thing? Welfare consequences of market transparency(with Burkhard Hehenkamp), Ungated Working Paper, Journal of Institutional and Theoretical Economics, June 2014
Transparency, Entry, and Productivity (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, Economics Letters, April 2012
Price-Dependent Demand in Spatial Models (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, B.E. Journal of Economic Analysis & Policy, March 2012
Transparency, Price-Dependent Demand and Product Variety (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, Economics Letters, March 2011
A Note on the Excess Entry Theorem in Spatial Models with Elastic Demand (with Tobias Wenzel), Ungated Working Paper, International Journal of Industrial Organization, September 2009

title: Yiquan Gu
text:
Housing and Land Economics

Park Life: the difference between having financial information and understanding it on park home owners’ quality of life (with Alexander Lord, Richard Dunning, Ian Wilson and Tom Moore), Town Planning Review, Forthcoming
Fair shares? Advancing land economics through cooperative game theory (with Alexander Lord et. al.), Land Use Policy, July 2021



Virtuous or vicious circles? Exploring the behavioural connections between developer contributions and path dependence: Evidence from England (with Alexander Lord, Gemma Burgess and Richard Dunning), Geoforum, November 2019
Can the market be tamed? A thought experiment on the value(s) of planning (with Alexander Lord), Environment and Planning A: Economy and Space, February 2019

title: Yiquan Gu
text:
Behavioral Foundations

Evolutionary Equilibrium in Contests with Stochastic Participation: Entry, Effort and Overdissipation (with Burkhard Hehenkamp and Wolfgang Leininger), Ungated Working Paper, Journal of Economic Behavior and Organization, August 2019
Bid outcome processing in Vickrey auctions: An ERP study (with Alice Newton-Fenner et. al.), Psychophysiology, June 2022
A comparison of reward processing during Becker–DeGroot–Marschak and Vickrey auctions: an ERP study (with Alice Newton-Fenner et. al.), Psychophysiology, April 2023
Economic value in the brain: a meta-analysis of willingness-to-pay using the Becker-DeGroot-Marschak auction, (with Alice Newton-Fenner et. al.), PLoS ONE, July 2023
